title: BT lobbies Boris to allow Huawei as condition of fibre rollout
text:
Openreach, BT’s quasi-independent network subsidiary, has shelved an overhaul of its board amid concerns it would give more sway to the parent company.

Mike McTighe, Openreach’s chairman, has been seeking to appoint BT’s strategy chief Michael Sherman as an extra director.

He has argued in meetings with industry peers that it would strengthen and speed up decision making as the telecoms sector enters a crucial phase of investment in full-fibre upgrades.

However, following protests from Sky and others who rely on Openreach's network while competing with BT, Mr McTighe last week agreed to put the plans on hold for a year in an attempt to build more trust in Openreach.
